channel.title: Comments on: Labels with white background in LaTeX terminals

item.title: By: Raoul
item.dc:creator: Raoul
item.description:
How can the LaTeX highlight \hl{} command be used with the sprintf string function?
What is missing in this attempt: set for [i = 1:8] label at first 0, first r*(i/9.0) sprintf('\hl{"%d°"}', r-i*10) center front
item.content:encoded:
How can the LaTeX highlight \hl{} command be used with the sprintf string function?

What is missing in this attempt:
set for [i = 1:8] label at first 0, first r*(i/9.0) sprintf(‘\hl{“%d°”}’, r-i*10) center front

item.title: By: hagen
item.dc:creator: hagen
item.description: Perfect, I updated the entry accordingly as it is much nicer this way.
item.content:encoded: Perfect, I updated the entry accordingly as it is much nicer this way.

item.title: By: kosmo
item.dc:creator: kosmo
item.description: \setlength{\fboxsep}{0pt} reduces the extra space of a colorbox to the given length.
item.content:encoded: \setlength{\fboxsep}{0pt} reduces the extra space of a colorbox to the given length.
